instructions: In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
In a large bowl, whisk together the egg, oil, milk, and vanilla extract. Add the dry mixture and stir with a wooden or silicone spoon. If too thick, add 1–2 Tbsp of milk.
Peel (optional) and dice the apple into small chunks. Fold them into the batter.
Prepare the crumble topping: combine butter, sugar, flour, and cinnamon in a medium bowl. Mix with a fork until small clumps form and no dry bits remain.
Scoop the batter evenly into a 12-cup muffin pan lined with paper cups. Sprinkle crumble topping evenly over each muffin.
Bake for 20–28 minutes, or until golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean (about 25 minutes in most ovens).
Cool muffins in the pan for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
